Arcane Background (Gifted).name: 奥法背景 (异禀)
Arcane Background (Gifted).description:
Arcane Background (Gifted)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.集中]{集中 } (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 })
  • STARTING POWERS: 1
  • POWER POINTS: 15

The character has innate abilities that don’t fit into the usual tropes of magic, miracles, or psionics. Their powers may be low-level super powers, divine gifts, or even alien abilities, and are often very unusual or unique for their setting.

Arcane Background (Magic).name: 奥法背景 (魔法)
Arcane Background (Magic).description:
Arcane Background (Magic)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.施法]{施法 } (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 })
  • STARTING POWERS: 3
  • POWER POINTS: 10

Magicians range from powerful wizards to vile cultists. They draw on raw supernatural energy to fuel their eldritch fires. This energy infuses the worlds in which they live, and is drawn forth with gestures, words of power, or ancient runes.

Arcane Background (Weird Science).name: 奥法背景 (奇异科学)
Arcane Background (Weird Science).description:
Arcane Background (Weird Science)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.奥法背景 (奇异科学)]{奇异科学 } (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 })
  • STARTING POWERS: 2
  • POWER POINTS: 15

Weird scientists use strange and powerful inventions beyond the normal technological level of the setting. Such creations might be possible due to super fuels, alien discoveries, or the raw intellect of rare super-geniuses who push the boundaries of science.

A weird scientist’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 } must always include the item they’re associated with. The burst power might manifest through a magical flame­thrower in Deadlands: The Weird West, for instance, while “Dr. Gabriel’s Wondrous Restorative Elixir!” is a healing potion.

Weird scientists must have their devices at hand to activate their powers (but see Jury Rig, below).

Other characters can’t activate the inventor’s creations. They might not understand the strange mechanisms required to make it work, the device might not be “calibrated” or portioned for other users, or it might just “fritz out” for anyone but the creator. While this may seem a bit strange narratively, the “magic”—and the Power Points—come from the inventor so he must be the one to activate it

Creating devices for others is possible—it just requires an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法装置]{奥法装置 } and the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.神器师]{神器师 } Edge.

The inventor can use his devices on others, of course, including administering drinks from his magical elixirs or giving them injections of some miraculous super serum he’s created. If Dr. Gabriel administers his elixir, for example, he rolls to activate the power normally. If he gives someone the bottle to use later, they’ll find it’s lost its potency.

Jury Rig： Weird scientists must usually activate their powers through their assigned device, but they can improvise other ways if needed at a −2 penalty. This requires a decent rationale relative to the setting and the GM’s permission.

Example： Gabe is captured by evil aliens and all his equipment is taken. He’s placed in a holding cell and decides he’ll use the overhead lights and whatever the aliens use for electricity to create a makeshift blast. The GM agrees this will work, but only once since it will destroy the lights and short out the cell’s energy in the process.

Arcane Background (Psionics).name: 奥法背景 (灵能)
Arcane Background (Psionics).description:
Arcane Background (Psionics)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.灵能]{灵能 } (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 })
  • STARTING POWERS: 3
  • POWER POINTS: 10

Psionicists tap into their own mental energy to manipulate matter, read minds, and far more. Some are agents in the employ of a vast government agency, while others are often on the run from them! Some may have years of training or they might have developed their incredible powers in isolation.

Arcane Background (Miracles).name: 奥法背景 (奇迹)
Arcane Background (Miracles).description:
Arcane Background (Miracles)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.信仰]{信仰 } (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 })
  • STARTING POWERS: 3
  • POWER POINTS: 10

Those who invoke miracles draw their power from a divine presence of some sort, including gods, nature, or spirits. Their powers are usually invoked with a few words of prayer or by performing established rituals.

Those who cast miracles are champions of their particular religions. They typically have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } that pertain to their service, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.誓言]{誓言 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.义务]{义务 }. They might also have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.人脉]{人脉 } to others of their religion who can help them out when their divine energies wane.

Fear.name: 恐惧
Fear.description:
Fear

Cold dread seizes the heroine as she enters the lost tomb. A dragon emerges from the cave, belching smoke and fire at the adventurers who threaten its hoard. An investigator stumbles upon a scene of grisly, ritualistic carnage.

These rules reflect the horror of these terrible situations upon your heroes’ psyches.

When to Use These 规则： Characters in realistic, horror, or “dark” games should usually be subject to the constant effects of fear and terror. Fear in high fantasy or super hero games is probably only used as the effect of a creature ability or arcane power.

The Basics： Characters make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{心魂投骰 } when confronted by creatures or situations that cause Fear.

Fear Checks

The heroes make a Fear check (a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{心魂投骰 } as a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{自由动作 }) when they first spot a creature with the Fear ability.

Success means a character manages to overcome the situation and carry on. A failed Fear check means the unfortunate soul faces the consequences below, depending on whether the source of fear was grotesque or terrifying in nature：

  • Nausea： If the scene was grotesque or horrific, such as a grisly discovery or learning a secret “Man Was Not Meant to Know,” the character is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } means the victim must roll on the Fear Table as well.
  • Terror： A terrifying trigger, such as a monstrous creature or unknowable evil, is much more intense. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{龙套 } are typically Panicked. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } must roll on the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-macros.Fear Table]{恐惧表 } (at +2 with a Critical Failure on the Fear check). Roll a d20 and add the monster’s Fear penalty, if any, to the roll (a −2 adds +2 to the roll, for example).

Becoming Jaded

After encountering a particular type of creature, the character shouldn’t have to make Fear checks every time he sees another in that particular scenario. If the party clears out an asylum full of spectral inmates, for example, they should only have to roll the first time they encounter them—not in every room. The Game Master might require a roll if the heroes encounter such horrors in a particularly different or frightening situation, however.

Fear Table

For a rollable version of this table, please use this @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-macros.Fear Table]{恐惧宏 } which rolls on the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.Fear Table]{恐惧表 }

*Add the creature’s Fear penalty as a positive number to this roll.

Fear Table
D20* Effect
1-3 Adrenaline Surge: The hero’s “fight” response takes over. He acts as if he had a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{鬼牌 } this action!
4-6 Distracted: The hero is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 } until the end of his next turn.
7-9 Vulnerable: The target is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } until the end of his next turn.
10-12 Shaken: The character is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }.
13 The Mark of Fear: The hero is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 } and suffers some cosmetic physical alteration—a white streak forms in his hair, his eyes twitch constantly, or some other minor physical alteration manifests.
14-15 Frightened: The character gains the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.犹豫不决]{犹豫不决 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } for the remainder of the encounter. If he already has it, he’s Panicked instead.
16-17 Panicked: The character immediately moves his full @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } plus running die away from the danger and is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }.
18-19 Minor Phobia: The character gains a Minor @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.恐惧症]{恐惧症 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } somehow associated with the trauma.
20-21 Major Phobia: The character gains the Major @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.恐惧症]{恐惧症 } Hindrance.
22+ Heart Attack: The hero is so over­whelmed with fear that his heart stutters. He must make an immediate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll at –2. If successful, he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 }. If he fails, he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 } and dies in 2d6 rounds. In the latter case, a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{医疗 } roll at –4 saves his life, but he remains Incapacitated. He may be treated normally thereafter.

Healing.name: 恢复
Healing.description:
Healing

The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{医疗 } skill is used to remove @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }. Each attempt requires 10 minutes per wound level of the patient. Subtract 1 from Healing rolls without a basic First Aid kit or similar supplies.

A success removes one Wound, and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } removes two. Failure means no Wounds are removed. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } increases the victim’s Wound level by one.

The Golden Hour

Patients who survive their initial trauma have about an hour to survive most life-threatening injuries. If they receive medical attention during that time, they can generally be saved. The longer the wait, however, the more likely the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } are to be fatal.

In Savage Worlds, we extend this concept to healing in general. Besides reflecting the real-world concept, it also provides good game balance and drama as the party has to decide whether to press on despite their injuries.

The Golden Hour: A character may only attempt to heal @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } on a patient once within the hour they were sustained. Failing the roll means the healer isn’t able to treat those particular injuries. A different character may attempt a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{医疗 } roll on the same patient, however.

Once the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } are over an hour old, only natural healing or the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{医疗 } power (using greater healing) can heal Wounds.

Bleeding Out: The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{医疗 } skill can also be used to stabilize someone who’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{失血 }. Each attempt is an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }, and if successful the victim is stabilized.

Incapacitation: Healing at least one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } on an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 } patient removes that state (and restores consciousness if he was knocked out).

Natural Healing

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } characters make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } roll every five days. Success recovers one Wounds, and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } recovers two.

A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } increases the victim’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } level by one—either from infection, blood loss, or aggravating the injuries. If this causes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 }, don’t use the usual rules for taking damage. Instead, the victim lapses in and out of consciousness and makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } roll every 12 hours. If the roll is failed, he expires. Success means he must roll again 12 hours later. With a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } he stabilizes and wakes. Allies may also attempt to stabilize the hero as explained under Bleeding Out, above.

Support: Don’t forget to use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.援助]{援助 } when your party has been beaten up a bit. Characters with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{医疗 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.生存]{生存 }, or other skills can make Support rolls to help allies make their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } rolls to heal!

Aftermath & Extras

If it’s important to know what happens to Extras who were @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 } during a fight, make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } roll for each. Those who succeed survive and must be cared for, taken prisoner, or released. This can present interesting challenges for your heroes in the aftermath of savage combat!

Half-Elves.name: 半精灵
Half-Elves.description:
半精灵

半精灵保有了精灵的魅力，但丝毫没继承后者的优雅和纤细。大部分半精灵都能适应社会，但仍有一些被家庭中一方或是其他人所排斥，并滋长出了愤恨。甚至还有一些会惨遭虐待。半精灵的寿命与比起他们的精灵血亲更接近人类的双亲，只能活大概100年左右。

  • 传承：半精灵能保留其精灵双亲的优雅或是人类血统的适应力。半精灵能在开始时随意选择一个免费的入门@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }，或是让初始@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 }从d4变成d6(这也让其灵巧上限提升到d12+1)。
  • 微光视觉：半精灵能忽略昏暗和黑暗造成的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }减值。
  • 异客(次要)：半精灵在人类或者精灵社会中都会感到不自在，其在踏足两个世界的同时，却又永不属于任何一方。半精灵和其他任何非同族互动时的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 }投骰-2。

Half-Folk.name: 半身人
Half-Folk.description:
半身人

半身人瘦小而灵活，有着一头毛茸茸的黑色或棕色头发。尽管比起其他大部分种族更为孱弱，但根植于半身人的积极乐观(或是狡诈精明)之上是“永不言败”的态度，他们因此能战胜体型比自己大上两号的生物。半身人不愿意自找麻烦，他们通常生活在偏僻至极，关系紧密的社会当中。

  • 幸运：半身人在每回游戏开始时都会额外获得一点@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 }。
  • 缓慢移速：角色的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }-1，并且奔跑骰子类型下降一级。
  • 体型-1：半身人平均只有四英尺高，@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型 }(因此还有@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 })-1。
  • 精神抖擞：半身人通常都是乐观积极，他们起始的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 }从d4变成d6，这让其心魂上限提升到d12+1。

Saurians.name: 蜥蜴人
Saurians.description:
蜥蜴人

蜥蜴人通常来自雾气弥漫的丛林或是沙漠深处，他们独一无二的文明对于其他知性种族来说闻所未闻。

  • 护甲+2：蜥蜴人的皮肤覆有如同@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{皮甲 }那般的鳞片。
  • 噬咬：蜥蜴人的尖牙是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.天生武器]{天生武器 })，其造成的伤害为力量+d4。
  • 环境弱点：尽管蜥蜴人并非真正的冷血动物，但他们仍然难以适应严寒环境。蜥蜴人在抵抗@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{寒冷 }环境效果时遭受-4减值，同时基于寒冷的攻击对其伤害+4。
  • 敏锐感官：蜥蜴人有着敏锐的感官，其获得@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.警觉]{警觉 }专长。
  • 异客(次要)：大部分种族都因为某些原因不信任蜥蜴人。可能是因为其怪异的传统和行事方式，或是其经常丝丝作响的腔调，或是潜意识中对于其爬虫类先祖的古老恐惧。蜥蜴人和其他非同族的任何种族互动时的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 }投骰-2。

Creative Combat.name: 创新战斗
Creative Combat.description:
Creative Combat

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.考验]{考验 } make a game even more exciting and memorable. Creative Combat enhances a pulp-style game with additional benefits for those who Test with a raise.

A successful Test works as usual, but if a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } character succeeds with a raise while in combat, her foe is not automatically @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }—she rolls on the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.创新战斗]{创新战斗表 } instead.

Humans.name: 人类
Humans.description:
人类

人类在大部分设定中都能自选一个免费专长。该选项反映了他们比起其他大部分种族更为突出的多样性及适应力。

追求多样性的GM能基于文化而非种族给与人类不同的能力。举例而言，基于马匹的游牧社会也许起始会具备骑乘和生存技能。设计文化模板就和创造新种族一样，但GM应当比起平时允许更多例外，因为能力通常是后天习得，而非真正的与生俱来。

  • 适应：人类在游戏开始时可以任选一个入门@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }，但必须如常满足需求。

Android.name: 仿生人
Android.description:
仿生人

仿生人是由先进科技制造出来的半有机存在。这里的范例大体上是以人类为模板，而且它们若是愿意也一般能瞒天过海(只要没被医生检查)。它们先进的神经网络使其获得和别的知性生物没有区别的人工智能，具备独立人格、癖好和感情。

这里列出的仿生人版本是普通型号，要创造更为特殊的仿生人，使用@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.创造种族]{这里 }列出的定制种族能力。

  • 和平主义(主要)：除非是为了战斗而设计，大部分高科技社会都会要求安装“阿西莫夫思考回路”，这是基于科幻小说作家艾萨克·阿西莫夫的“机器人第一定论”概念。人造存在不得伤害另一知性生物，以及通过采取行动或者袖手旁观而让这种生物受到伤害。仿生人们因此获得@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.和平主义]{和平主义 }(主要)负赘。
  • 构装体：仿生人在从@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }中恢复时+2，无须呼吸，忽略一级@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }调整值，同时免疫毒素和疾病。构装体不能自然恢复。@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.医疗]{恢复 }一个损伤需要使用@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.修理]{修理 }技能，且尝试需要花费等同于当下损伤等级小时数的时间，同时不受@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.医疗]{“黄金时间” }的限制。
  • 异客(主要)：仿生人和其他非同族的任何种族互动时的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 }投骰-2，并且在大部分地区没有法定权利(通常被当作是财产)。
  • 誓言(主要)：构装体都是为了特定目的而设计。玩家角色的构装体具备一个宽泛的指令，诸如服务某个特定公司或是政治派别等等，处理该特定指令时如同@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.誓言]{誓言 }主要负赘。如果这造成了利益上的冲突，则玩家和GM必须一同协定构装体程序的运算结果。

Aquarian.name: 鲛人
Aquarian.description:
鲛人

鲛人来自水压惊人的大洋深处。他们在波涛底下强健自如，但在地表的干燥空气或是灼热高温中则会脆弱无比。

  • 水栖：鲛人不会溺水，而且游泳时能以全移速移动。常规游泳速度见@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移动 }。
  • 依赖：鲛人每24小时必须将自己浸没在水中一小时，否则每天将会自动陷入疲乏，直到陷入无力化。他们因为脱水而@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 }超过一天后，就会死亡。每泡在水中一小时能恢复一级@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }。
  • 微光视觉：鲛人已经习惯了深海的黑暗，他们忽略因昏暗和黑暗@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }造成的减值。
  • 坚韧：水世界深处的生活让鲛人的肉体强韧过人，@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }+1。

Avion.name: 翼民
Avion.description:
翼民

翼民是有翅膀的类人种。他们的体格因为中空的骨头而脆弱轻盈。某些翼民双翅生羽，而其他的则是背长皮翼甚至是鳞翼。

  • 不谙水性：翼民的翅膀在水中百无一用。他们的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }(游泳)投骰-2，而且在水中每移动一英寸消耗3英寸移速。
  • 飞行：翼民每轮能以12的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }飞行，并以@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }技能进行机动。
  • 羸弱：因为骨头中空，翼民的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }-1。
  • 敏锐感官：翼民比起其他种族更要敏锐，他们初始的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.察觉]{察觉 }技能是d6(而不是d4)，而且可以将该技能提升到d12+1。
  • 缓慢移速：因为对飞行的依赖以及笨重的翅膀，翼民在行走时较为迟缓，其行走@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }-1，并且奔跑骰下降一级。

Dwarves.name: 矮人
Dwarves.description:
矮人

矮人来自大型洞穴或崇山峻岭，矮壮结实，坚毅勇敢。他们是富有荣耀，骁勇善战的种族，并经常接触诸如兽人或是哥布林这类敌意十足的种族。

矮人通常能活200年以上，在大部分的奇幻战役里，他们都有着红润的皮肤以及所有人类的发色。

  • 微光视觉：矮人的眼睛适应了地底的黑暗，他们能忽略昏暗和黑暗造成的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }减值。
  • 缓慢移速：矮人的双腿相较大部分种族更为短小，其@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }-1，并且奔跑骰子类型下降一级。
  • 健硕：矮人强壮精悍，他们起始的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 }从d4变成d6，并且活力上限提升到d12+1。

Dynamic Backlash.name: 动态反冲
Dynamic Backlash.description:
Dynamic Backlash

A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } on an arcane skill check results in @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }. That works well in traditional fantasy settings or worlds where magic is relatively common. If you feel magic should come with a higher price, however, use the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.动态反冲]{动态反冲 } table instead.

Example： Gabe is a techno-sorceror in some far-flung science fiction world. He rolls a Critical Failure when casting lower Trait against an enemy’s Agility. Gabe’s player rolls Backfire on the Dynamic Backlash table so it affects his friend Red instead.
Red’s Agility suddenly drops two die types, forcing the warrior to go on the defensive until the power wears off.

Elves.name: 精灵
Elves.description:
精灵

精灵是耳朵长尖，双眼深陷，瞳孔多彩的瘦高生灵。尽管无论来自深幽密林或是避世村落的精灵都略微纤细，但其生来都比人类更为优雅。大部分精灵都能活到300年以上，他们有着白皙的皮肤，在具备所有人类发色的同时，还有着银、蓝和金的渐变发色。

  • 灵巧：精灵优雅而灵巧，他们起始的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 }从d4变成d6，并且灵巧上限提升到d12+1。
  • 一窍不通：精灵天生反感机械造物，并因此获得@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.一窍不通]{一窍不通 }负赘。他们会避开大部分机械造物和机械设计。
  • 微光视觉：精灵的眼睛能放大光线，其他种族经常宣称自己能在精灵的眼眸中看到闪烁星辰。精灵能忽略昏暗和黑暗造成的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }减值。

Rakashans.name: 猫族
Rakashans.description:
猫族

猫族是类人猫科动物。其中一些有着老虎般明亮的色彩，豹子的斑点皮毛或是暹罗猫的奇异外表。所有猫族都具备尖牙利爪，以及对付猎物时的冷酷天性。

猫族常见于他们自己那偏远而奇异的城市，或是作为正常社会边缘的元素出现。他们过人的魅力以及头脑通常让人难以生厌，但同时又狡诈得让人无法完全信任。

  • 灵巧：猫科动物的优雅让猫族的起始@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 }从d4变成d6，这让其灵巧上限提升到d12+1。
  • 噬咬/爪抓：猫族的尖牙和利爪是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.天生武器]{天生武器 }，其造成的伤害为力量+d4。
  • 嗜血：猫族面对敌人时冷酷无比，而且会出于单纯的愉悦而玩弄对方。猫族鲜少会留下俘虏，并且在惩罚抓获的敌人时毫无内疚。他们具有@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.嗜血]{嗜血 }负赘。
  • 不谙水性：猫族其实能游泳，只是他们对此不擅长，同时也会敬而远之。他们的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }(游泳)投骰-2，而且位于桌面上时每在水中移动一英寸消耗3英寸@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }。
  • 微光视觉：猫族的眼睛能放大光线，他们忽略昏暗和黑暗造成的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 }减值。
  • 种族夙敌：猫族社会乃是以他族作为代价才得以崛起。选择世设中的某一普通种族，双方成员在相处时@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 }-2，而且通常见面就会开打。

Character Creation Summary.name: 角色创建概要
Character Creation Summary.description:
角色创建概要

概念

  • 开始时要定好想玩什么样的形象，设定书也许能为此提供大量点子。

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.种族]{种族 }

  • 选择角色的@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.种族]{种族 }，并应用所有其赋予的好处或特殊能力。

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 }

  • 选择至多4点负赘(主要负赘等价2点，次要负赘等价1点)。
  • 每2点负赘点可以把一项属性骰子类型提升一级，或是选择一个专长。
  • 每1点负赘点可以获得1点额外技能点，或是获得等同于设定中起始数量两倍的额外起始资金。

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{属性 }

  • 属性开始时均为d4，有5点可以分配其上，每升一级消耗1点。
  • 除非角色的种族好处另有说明，否则属性不能提升到超过d12。

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{技能 }

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.通用知识]{通用知识 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.察觉]{察觉 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.潜行]{潜行 }是核心技能，因此初始即免费为d4。
  • 有12点可以分配到任何技能上。
  • 骰子类型每升一级消耗1点，直到等同于关联属性为止，此后每升一级消耗2点。

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{衍生数值 }

  • 标准@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }是6英寸，但可能会因为种族能力、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 }发生变化。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 }是2+格斗的一半。

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }是2+@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{活力 }的一半，然后加上所有@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 }值。

    注意护甲的数值要像这样写在括号里—􍄔坚韧：11(2)。这意味着总共11点坚韧中有2点来自护甲，@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.穿甲 (AP)]{穿甲 }攻击能越过这2点，但不包括另外9点。


@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }

  • 若是愿意，使用任何剩余的负赘点来选取专长。
  • 每个专长消耗2点负赘点。

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.装备注释]{装备 }

  • 购买至多价值$500的装备。

Special Ability (Stun).name: 特殊能力 (震慑)
Special Ability (Stun).description:
Stun

A creature with this ability often has an electrical attack, mild toxin, mind lash, or similar trapping. When it successfully hits a character (even if it causes no damage), she must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll minus any listed penalties or be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 }.

Special Ability (Swat).name: 特殊能力 (猛击)
Special Ability (Swat).description:
Swat

The creature has learned how to deal with pesky creatures smaller than itself. It ignores up 4 points of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸 } penalties when attacking with certain abilities listed in its description (and only those specific abilities).

Poison.name: 毒素
Poison.description:
Poison

The bane of adventurers across all Savage Worlds can be delivered by the smallest of foes—poison!

When an adventurer comes into contact with poison (at least a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } result if an attack) he must make an immediate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{投骰 } minus the Strength of the poison (if listed). Failure means the character is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 } in addition to any specific effects listed below.

  • KNOCKOUT: The victim is knocked out (Incapacitated and unconscious) for 2d6 hours (twice that with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 }).
  • LETHAL: The victim is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 }, takes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } (two with a Critical Failure), and perishes in 2d6 rounds.
  • MILD: The victim suffers @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{力竭 } with a Critical Failure. This cannot cause Incapacitation.
  • PARALYZING: The victim is Incapacitated for 2d6 minutes, or twice that with a Critical Failure.

These are basic and simplified poison effects that can be altered as needed to suit specific creatures or hazards. A particularly deadly snake in your fantasy world, for example, might still cause @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{力竭 } to those who resist its effects, or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 } with a raise.

Treatment： A character may make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{医疗 } roll minus the strength of the poison (if any modifier is listed) to stop its effects. If this action is successful, the victim’s life is saved and the poison no longer has any ill effects—paralyzed victims can move and those rendered unconscious wake.

Each character may only attempt one Healing roll at −2 roll per incident to cure the poison, but another character with Healing may make a second attempt, and so on.

Action Cards (Initiative).description:
Action Cards (Initiative)

The action in Savage Worlds is fast and furious. To help the Game Master keep track of who goes in what order and add a little randomness to the game, we use a single deck of playing cards with both Jokers left in to determine everyone’s initiative order. We call these “Action Cards.”

The GM can deal cards face up or face down as she sees fit. She might also deal the players’ cards face up and the villains face down to increase the players’ tension and uncertainty!

At the start of each round：

  • Deal each @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } a single Action Card (plus any extra cards for @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }). Allies under a player’s control act on his Action Card.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{龙套 }, such as all zombies, all wolves, and so on, should usually share an Action Card so they act at the same time. This makes them much easier to manage. She can also group Wild Cards with their minions if she wants. The goal is to do whatever makes running the battle as quick and easy as possible.

Shuffle: Shuffle the deck after any round in which a Joker was dealt.

Large Groups: In very large groups or time-sensitive games, the Game Master can deal a single card per side (heroes and villains). On the heroes’ turn, simply start at one end of the group and work quickly around. This speeds things up dramatically if that’s more important than varying initiative order. If one or more characters have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.沉稳冷静]{沉稳冷静 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.迅捷]{迅捷 }, let that apply to the draw (but only once).

The Countdown

Once the cards are dealt, the Game Master starts the round by counting down from Ace down to Two, with each group resolving its actions when its card comes up.

Ties: Ties are resolved by suit order: Spades ♠ are first, then Hearts ♥, Diamonds ♦, and Clubs ♣. That’s reverse alphabetical order as used in many common card games.

  • JOKERS: Characters (or groups) with a Joker act whenever they want in the round, even interrupting another’s action. They also add +2 to all @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } rolls this round!
Action Cards (Initiative).name: 行动卡 (先攻)

Actions.description:
Actions

Characters perform “actions” when their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{行动卡 } comes up each round. A character can move (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移动 }) and perform one regular action at any point in their movement, attacking, casting a spell, and so on, without penalty.

Characters can choose from a multitude of actions on their turn. Common actions include @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.援助]{援助 } allies, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.考验]{考验 } foes, using a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 }, or attacking with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.多重动作]{多重动作 } to perform more than one action per turn.

More complex actions like lighting a torch or digging through a backpack for a small item might require a set or random amount of time (such as [[/r 1d6]] rounds—GM’s call).

Free Actions

Speaking a short sentence or two, moving up to the character’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }, falling @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.卧地]{卧地 }, or dropping an item are all free actions. A hero can generally perform several free actions on her turn simultaneously (speaking and dropping an item while walking, for example). The GM must decide how much is too much.

Some free actions occur automatically at the beginning of a character’s turn and may only be tried once, such as recovering from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 }.

Free actions that are “reactions,” such as resisting opposed rolls or powers, are unlimited and occur each time the situation presents itself.
Actions.name: 动作

Adventure Toolkit.name: 冒险工具箱
Adventure Toolkit.description:
冒险工具箱

以下章节包含了GM在经常于游戏里出现的所有特殊情况内使用的规则，诸如：

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.盟友]{盟友 }：管理玩家角色控制的龙套们。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{追逐与载具 }：惊险刺激的追逐，包括徒步、汽车、摩托车或者是庞大星船舰队之间的狗斗！
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.剧情任务]{剧情任务 }：在诸如拆弹或骇入电脑等情况当中增添紧张的戏码。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.恐惧]{恐惧 }：压倒性恐怖的效果。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 }：酷热高温、刺骨严寒、辐射等种种效果。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.幕间]{幕间 }：在漫长的旅途中叙述故事，或是揭示玩家角色的背景故事。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.大规模作战]{大规模作战 }：敌我差距悬殊时的拼死一搏。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.打点关系]{打点关系 }：收集信息或请求帮助。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.快速遭遇]{快速遭遇 }：战斗、掠夺或是犯事在赶时间时的简单快捷结算方式。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.设定规则]{设定规则 }：一系列能用在定制化世设里面的特殊规则！
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.社交冲突]{社交冲突 }：进行庭审、恳求援助或是说服群众。
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.旅行]{旅行 }：弄清楚团队在自设狂野世界里跋涉需要多长时间！
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.财富]{财富 }：这个可选系统面向的是不希望计较收入及支出的人士。

Aim.name: 瞄准
Aim.description:
Aim

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } rolls assume a character is moving about, dodging attacks, and keeping an eye on the chaos around her. If she focuses her attention and aims, however, she can make a much more accurate shot.

If a character spends her entire turn Aiming a ranged weapon at a particular target and takes no other actions, on her next turn she may ignore up to 4 points of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.速度]{速度 } penalties; or add +2 to her roll. Her attack must be used on the first action of her next turn or the bonus is lost

The shooter must be “stationary” to Aim. She can’t walk, run, ride a horse, or otherwise move under her own power. She could Aim from a vehicle traveling over or through a smooth surface, or one using the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{保持稳定 } Chase maneuver.

Aircraft Table.name: 飞行器表
Aircraft Table.description:
Use the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.载具注释]{联装武器 } rules to divide guns into the largest possible blocks. Roll the machine guns on a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-vehicles.P-51 野马战斗机]{野马战斗机 } as three sets of two, for example, and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-vehicles.喷火MK2A战斗机]{喷火MK2A战斗机 } as two sets of four.

Arcane Backgrounds.description:
Arcane Backgrounds

Start by choosing one of the Arcane Back­ground Edges available in your campaign. Five different types are presented in this book: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (异禀)]{异禀 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (魔法)]{魔法 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (奇迹)]{奇迹 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (灵能)]{灵能 }和@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (奇异科学)]{奇异科学 }.

Each type has the following entries：

  • ARCANE SKILL: Each type of power has a particular arcane @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{技能 } listed in its description. Take this skill and buy it just like any other on the skill list. The attribute to which the skill is linked is listed in parentheses beside the skill itself.
  • STARTING POWERS: The number of powers a hero starts with at @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色创建概要]{角色创建 }. Additional abilities may be learned with the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.新奇术]{新奇术 }@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }. The player and Game Master can decide if there’s a narrative reason for this (a cleric is given a revelation, a wizard finds an old spellbook) or it’s simply an evolution of her abilities.
  • POWER POINTS: The number of Power Points the character starts with when she chooses an Arcane Background. A hero increases her Power Points by taking the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.获得奇术点]{获得奇术点 }@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }.

Versatility

The versatility of the Savage Worlds powers system allows you to emulate any genre you can imagine using the same powers you become familiar with in different ways.

Emily likes to play a paladin in fantasy games. She uses @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.痛击]{痛击 } on her sword with a “light” @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }—it glows with the holy power of the order she serves. In a scifi world, it becomes a laser sword.

Nate’s wizard in a fantasy setting uses ice magic to hurl freezing @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } of devastating energy from his hands. In a scifi game, he might be more of a tinkerer-type who uses a “freeze gun” with the same power.

As you get to know the powers and what they can do, you can give them different names and descriptions that make them feel new and interesting without changing the core mechanics. This versatility is extremely powerful, fast, and fun.

Multiple Arcane Backgrounds

Though it should be rare, the Game Master might allow a character to take multiple @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奥法背景 } in her setting. With her permission, treat each Arcane Background as its own set, adding powers, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.无奇术点]{无奇术点 }, and buying appropriate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{技能 } separately.

Supers

True “four color” super heroes are beyond the scope of these powers. See the Savage Worlds Super Powers Companion for a fast, fun, and compre­hensive treatment of super powers, from street-level crime fighters to cosmic champions!
Arcane Backgrounds.name: 奥法背景

Arcane Devices.name: 奥法装置
Arcane Devices.description:
Arcane Devices

A character with the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.神器师]{神器师 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } can focus items into devices for herself or others. The advantage is that they can be given to and used by allies. The trade-off is that devices take a little preparation to create and can be lost or destroyed.

Devices may be technological in nature, or they might be sacred, enchanted, or psychically powered objects, depending on the creator’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奥法背景 }.

Note： Arcane devices are relatively temp­orary creations player characters can create from their powers. Truly permanent “magic” items or devices are setting-specific, don’t use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 }, and are created by the Game Master as she sees fit (such as those found in the Savage Worlds Fantasy Companion).

The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.无奇术点]{无奇术点 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.设定规则]{设定规则 } isn’t compatible with Arcane Devices.

Creation

Creating a device takes one hour per @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 } that can be activated through it. The player must list which powers are in the device and then allocate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } to it. The device can only use the powers and Power Points allocated to it.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } invested in an arcane device are lost to the inventor until they’re used or recovered with Tinkering, see below (they don’t recharge).

Power Modifiers： A user may spend a device’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } as desired, including enabling any applicable @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术调整]{奇术调整 }.

Arcane devices may not be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.启动]{减耗 }.

Limitations： Arcane devices may benefit from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{限制 }.

Activation： The creator uses his arcane skill as usual. Others use whatever skill is associated with the device’s form—guns use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }, grenades use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } (throwing), and so on. If there is no other obvious skill, such as for a potion or worn item, the character rolls the inventor’s arcane skill as if it were his own (he does not benefit from any of the creator’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } or other abilities, however).

Failure to activate the device costs one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奇术点 } as usual, and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } causes the user @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }.

Tinkering： A creator can reassign up to five @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } per action between an arcane device and her own pool. She must be in physical contact with the item to do so. Inventors should lend out their devices very carefully!

Example: Gabe is an alchemist. He makes an “oil of sharpness” Red can rub on her sword to activate the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.痛击]{痛击 } power. He invests four @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } into it. Red soon finds herself in battle with the undead. She rubs the oil on the blade and rolls Gabe’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (奇异科学)]{奇异科学 } (since there’s no other obvious skill). She fails, which drains the oil of one Power Point. She tries again in the next round and gets a raise, granting her sword +4 damage. Smite normally costs 2 Power Points but Gabe’s Trapping has the “@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.接触攻击]{接触 }” Limitation so it only costs 1 point each time she applies it (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }).

Arcane Device Examples

Dr. Destruction makes an invisibility belt and gives it to one of his minions. He has 20 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } and puts 5 of them into the belt, reducing his remaining pool to 15.

When the minion wants to turn invisible, he rolls Dr. Destruction’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景 (奇异科学)]{奇异科学 } skill. This costs 1 less Power Point than usual because of the belt’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{限制 }—it must be worn to activate so it has a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.接触攻击]{接触 }.

Dr. Destruction also gives the minion the bolt power in the form of a ray gun and invests it with 10 Power Points. The minion rolls @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } to fire it.

The minion suffers @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 } if he rolls a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } activating either device.

Once the belt or gun is out of energy, Dr. Destruction can recover the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } he invested in it normally (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.启动]{充能 }).

Area Effect Attacks.name: 范围效果攻击
Area Effect Attacks.description:
Area Effect Attacks

Grenades, spell effects, breath weapons, and other attacks that cover a large area are “area effect attacks.” The most common are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.爆散盖板]{小型，中型，大型爆散盖板和锥形盖板 }. There are copies you can print out on our website and we make durable acrylic versions as well.

Area effect weapons target a location rather than individuals and so ignore defensive bonuses for specific targets covered by the template, such as the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.闪避]{闪避 } Edge or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.速度]{速度 } penalties.

Cone templates are placed with the small end emanating from the attacker and fired with the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } skill (or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } for breath weapons and other natural attacks). A basic success means those beneath the template are hit. Failure means the attack didn’t occur for some reason—the creature failed to belch up noxious gas, the flamethrower malfunctioned, etc.

To attack with a blast template, the player places the template on the tabletop (or describes where he wants it to land) and rolls @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } for thrown weapons and breath attacks. If the attack fails and there’s a chance it might deviate and hit someone else, see Deviation, below.

If the roll is successful, any target even partially beneath the template is affected, regardless of any attack penalties to hit such as the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.闪避]{闪避 } Edge. If the effect causes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }, roll for each victim separately. Attacks that hit with a raise cause bonus @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } as usual.

Deviation

If an attack with a Cone Template fails, it goes over the targets’ heads, hits the ground, or simply falters for some reason. The GM may still decide the attack affects the area around it—perhaps a flamethrower sets a room on fire or a gas canister spews a cloud of gas—but there’s no game effect on characters or other targets this time.

If a blast template misses, it deviates 1d6″ for thrown weapons (such as grenades) and 2d6″ for fired projectiles. Multiply by 2 if the attack was made at Medium @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }, 3 if Long, and 4 for Extreme.

Templates Without Miniatures

Use the measurements below when you need to figure out how many enemies a template might affect.

The GM can also use the Targets Affected column to determine how many enemies are hit in narrative situations, modifying the results if the targets are more spread out (highly trained agents) or bunched up (a horde of zombies).

 
Template Diameter Targets Affected
Small 4 yards 2
Medium 8 yards 3
Large 12 yards 4
Cone 18-yard-long cone 3

Next roll a d12 and read it like a clock facing to determine the direction the missile deviates. A weapon can never deviate more than half the distance to the original target (that keeps it from going behind the thrower).

Cover & Area Effect Attacks

Solid obstacles like trees or brick walls protect against area effect attacks if they’re between the origin of the blast and the GM reasonably thinks they’d apply. Reduce the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } by the amount listed on the Cover Bonus table under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽与障碍 }

Armor.name: 护甲
Armor.description:
Armor

This is the amount of Armor provided by the equipment, listed in parentheses beside the wearer’s total @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }. Unless an attacker states otherwise, hits are always directed at the victim’s torso.

Worn Armor stacks with natural Armor (such as scaly skin) at its full value.

Worn Armor also stacks with one other layer. The lesser armor adds half its value (rounded down) to the total and increases the heavier armor’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.最低力量]{最低力量 } penalty a die type. Wearing a chain shirt (+3) beneath plate mail (+4), adds +1 to the wearer’s armor value, for a total of +5, and increases the Minimum Strength requirement to d12.

Armor Notes.name: 护甲注释
Armor Notes.description:
Armor

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 } is written in parentheses next to a character’s Toughness, like this: 11 (2). This means 2 points of the character’s 11 Toughness comes from Armor. An @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.穿甲 (AP)]{穿甲 } attack can bypass those 2 points but not the other 9.

Note that greaves (leg guards) and vambraces (arm guards) are listed as pairs. Halve the weight and cost if a character wears only half the set (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.最低力量]{最低力量 } doesn’t change).

Attacks.name: 攻击
Attacks.description:
Attacks

The basics of fast, furious combat are discussed below. Many additional options and situations are covered under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.规则]{情景规则 }.

Melee Attacks

The Target Number to hit an opponent is equal to the opponent’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.格挡]{格挡 } score (2 plus half his Fighting die type; 2 if he has no @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } skill).

Ranged Attacks

The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } skill covers everything from bows to pistols to rocket launchers and fixed machine guns. Throwing grenades, knives, spears, or other thrown projectiles uses the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } skill.

All ranged weapons have a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } statistic written like this: 5/10/20, or Short/Medium/Long Range.

The base Target Number to hit something at Short Range is 4. Firing at longer ranges inflicts the penalties listed below.

Range Penalties
Range Modifier
Short —
Medium -2
Long -4
Extreme (see notes) -8

Extreme Range: Extreme Range is up to 4× a weapon’s Long Range. Firing at such a great distance requires the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.瞄准]{瞄准 } option. When used in this way, Aim doesn’t reduce any penalties—it simply allows the character to fire at such a great distance. The penalty is −8, or −6 with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.普通装备表]{步枪瞄准镜 }.

Rate of Fire: Rate of Fire is how many shots (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } dice) a ranged weapon can fire in one action. A pistol with a RoF of 1, for example, can fire one shot per action. A machine gun with a Rate of Fire of 3 can fire three shots per action (10 actual bullets, see below).

For weapons with a Rate of Fire of 2 or higher, declare how many shots you’re putting into each possible target. Then roll that number of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } dice and assign them in whatever order you like to the targets you declared.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } roll their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } dice plus a Wild Die, which can be assigned wherever they like after seeing the result of the roll. They still can’t hit with more shots than the weapon’s Rate of Fire, however.

A Rate of Fire higher than 1 is an abstract value where each “shot” is actually a number of bullets. If you’re tracking bullets, use the table below and whatever Rate of Fire the character actually fires in an action, not the weapon’s maximum.

Bullets Per Rate of Fire
Rate of Fire Bullets Fired
1 1
2 5
3 10
4 20
5 40
6 50

Recoil: Firing more than one shot in one action from a weapon subtracts 2 from the attacker’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } rolls (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.后坐力]{后坐力 }).

Unless a weapon says otherwise, a shooter can fire less shots than his weapon’s maximum Rate of Fire.

Bennies.name: 助力点
Bennies.description:
Bennies

Every now and then, dice rolls may not work in your favor. That’s why Savage Worlds gives players a little control over their hero’s fate.

Player Character Bennies

Players start each game session with three “Bennies” (American slang for “benefits”), represented by poker chips, gaming stones, the official Bennies we make for all of our games, or other tokens that signify a little bit of good luck or fate.

Bennies are discarded at the end of each session—use them or lose them!

Bennies are awarded in two ways：

  • AWARDS: The Game Master should occa­sionally reward players for clever actions, roleplaying their character (especially any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 }), or a great feat of heroism.
    She can also award players a Benny for telling a great story in character, delivering a fantastic line that makes everyone laugh, or creating an emotional moment.
  • JOKER'S WILD: When a player character draws a Joker during combat, all player characters receive a Benny!

Game Master Bennies

Game Masters get Bennies too. At the start of each session, the GM gets one Benny for each player character. These may be used for any of his characters (including non-@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }!) throughout the course of the game.

Each of the GM’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } has two Bennies (plus any from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.幸运]{幸运 }) when they appear in the game. They can use these or any of the Bennies in the common pool as the GM wishes, but can’t share them without an Edge or ability that allows it.

Heroes get Bennies when they do some­thing clever, roleplay, or are affected by their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } in a scene. The GM doesn’t reward “herself” when roleplaying her villains, but her characters do benefit from drawing Jokers in combat：

  • JOKER'S WILD: Anytime the villains draw a Joker, put one Benny in their general pool and give another to each enemy @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }.

Using Bennies

Bennies may be spent at any appropriate time and don’t incur any sort of penalty. They may only be used on your own character.

Here are the ways characters can use their Bennies.

  • REROLL A TRAIT: Bennies grant a hero a reroll on any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }, and best of all, you get to keep the best total from all your rolls. The only exception is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 }, which ends the attempt and must be accepted. Such is the price of tempting fate!
  • RECOVER FROM @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }: This is instant and may be done at any time, even interrupting another’s actions if desired.
  • SOAK ROLLS: Bennies can also be used to prevent @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } or recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.化解投骰]{化解投骰 } for more information.
  • DRAW A NEW ACTION CARD: When the game is in rounds, a character can spend a Benny to get a new @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{行动卡 }. This occurs after all cards are dealt and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } like Quick, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.沉稳冷静]{沉稳冷静 }, or Hesitant are resolved. Then players or the GM may spend Bennies for an additional card as many times as they like and take their choice of all their draws. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } like @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.迅捷]{迅捷 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.沉稳冷静]{沉稳冷静 } do not apply to these additional cards drawn with Bennies. This continues until everyone (including the GM) passes. Then the round begins and no further cards may be drawn.
  • REROLL DAMAGE: You may spend a Benny to reroll @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 }. Include any additional dice you may have gained for a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } on the attack roll.
  • REGAIN POWER POINTS: A character with an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奥法背景 } can spend a Benny to regain 5 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 }.
  • INFLUENCE THE STORY: This one is entirely up to the Game Master, who may allow your character to spend a Benny to find an additional clue if you’re stuck, come up with some mundane but needed item, or push a nonplayer character into being a bit more agreeable.

Awarding Bennies

It takes a few games to figure out how many Bennies you should award players during a session. In general, we recommend you be fairly free with them, especially early in the game. If someone makes everyone laugh (and isn’t distracting the flow of the game), toss her a Benny. When someone roleplays a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 }, reward her. When someone does something clever or heroic or imaginative, acknowledge it with a Benny.

Some GMs worry the game will become too easy if Bennies are too common, but we find the opposite is true. When Bennies are plentiful, players often spend them on trivial things that are important to them. Maybe the thief really wants to pick the lock on a chest. There’s nothing particularly valuable inside and the player probably knows it, but he’s the thief and wants to prove himself to the rest of the party.

When Bennies are scarce, however, players tend to save them for injuries, death, or taking out the big bads. That’s fine, but takes away from the fun and heroics that got them to this point. Savage Worlds is about big action and players should be encouraged to take chances. The “currency” of these chances are those Bennies.

Veteran Savage Worlds GMs might also notice Bennies tend to flow fairly fast early on in a session. The group is settling in, laughing, and are rewarded for roleplaying their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } the first time or two. In the mid-to-late game, Bennies tend to be spent faster than they’re gained. That’s a fantastic pace. It gives the heroes opportunities to do big things in the early and mid-game then forces some resource management for the final showdown.

If you find yourself being stingy, go the other way the next time you run and see how it affects your group. Then you’ll know what’s right for you and your friends.

Bestiary

Great heroes are often defined by the foes, monsters, and other horrors they face. In this chapter are a number of the most common threats across the many Savage Worlds.

Designing Threats

Nonplayer characters and monsters should have any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } the GM feels are appropriate. 英雄处诞

Heroes may ignore the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{位阶 } qualifications for @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } during @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色创建概要]{角色创建 }. Bound and Entangled.name: 束缚与纠缠
Bound and Entangled.description:
Bound & Entangled

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.擒抱]{擒抱 } and powers like @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.纠缠]{纠缠 } cause characters to be Bound and Entangled. Here’s what each of those states means and how to break free from them.

  • ENTANGLED: The victim can’t move and is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 } as long as he remains so.
  • BOUND: The victim may not move, is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神与脆弱 } as long as he remains Bound, and cannot make physical actions other than trying to break free.

Breaking free is an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }. With success, an Entangled hero is free of one particular entanglement or grappler. A Bound character improves to Entangled with a success; with a raise, he’s free. See below for more details：

Breaking Free from a Foe: Use the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.擒抱]{擒抱 } rules in reverse to break free—the victim initiates an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll with whoever’s holding him (either may roll @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } at −2 instead to maintain or break free of the hold). If the victim’s successful, she improves her status one level, or two with a raise.

A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } grappler maintains her hold. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 } grapplers let go immediately.

Breaking Free from a Device： Escaping a web, net, or the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.纠缠]{纠缠 } power is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{力量 } −2 roll or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll (victim’s choice) minus any penalties noted for the entanglement. The sticky web of a giant spider, for example, might note that escape attempts are made at −2 or more. This is an action, and success works just like breaking free from a foe (explained above).

Characters and allies may also destroy the entanglement (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.破坏物体]{破坏物体 }). Webs, ropes, nets, and the like are generally Hardness 4 and must be cut with an edged weapon.

Breaking Things.name: 破坏物体
Breaking Things.description:
Breaking Things

Occasionally a character may want to break a solid object, such as a weapon, lock, or door. Use the wielder’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 } if held, or 2 if it’s motionless. If a damage roll equals or exceeds the object’s Hardness, it’s broken, bent, shattered, or otherwise ruined. The GM decides the exact effect.

Most anything can be broken given enough time and effort, so use this system only when attempting to break things in a hurry (such as during combat rounds).

Object Hardness
Hardness Object
8 Door, Light
10 Door, Heavy
8 Lock
9 Firearm (pistol or rifle)
12 Handcuffs
10 Knife, Sword
10 Medieval Shield*
12 Modern Shield*
4 Rope

* A character must specifically state he’s trying to break a shield to do so—don’t check every time the shield-bearer is hit.

No Bonus Damage or Aces: Attacks against solid objects don’t get bonus @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } from raises, and damage rolls don’t @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{绝佳 }. Unlike a person or complex device like a computer or a vehicle, an attack can’t hit a “vital” area on a lock or a door and thus do more damage.

Damage Types: Certain types of attacks can’t break certain types of objects. A club can’t cut a rope, for example, and a single bullet won’t destroy a door. Use common sense when determining whether or not a particular type of weapon can destroy an object.

See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽与障碍 } to attack through barriers.

Bumps and Bruises.name: 肿痛与擦伤
Bumps and Bruises.description:
Bumps & Bruises

Stumbling down a slope or running through a cavern in the dark might cause numerous cuts, scrapes, and bumps.

Characters moving through injurious terrain make an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll. Those who @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{失败 } gain a level of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }.

Recovery： Fatigue levels from Bumps & Bruises improve one level every 24 hours instead of every hour (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }).

A character may use the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{医疗 } skill to treat and cover the injuries, or medicate the patient to relieve pain at any time. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{成功 } relieves one level of Fatigue from Bumps & Bruises and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } relieves two. Each healer may attempt this roll only once unless the GM decides a change in circumstances warrants another opportunity (finding medical supplies, for example).

Caliber.description:
Caliber

The number listed in parentheses after firearms is the caliber of bullet it fires. Use this when figuring ammunition costs or trying to figure out if the ammo from one weapon fits in another. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.步枪表]{步枪 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.手枪表]{手枪 } ammo are not interchangeable unless otherwise noted.
Caliber.name: 口径

Called Shots.name: 定点攻击
Called Shots.description:
Called Shots

Targeting a particular part of the body is a Called Shot. The modifier to the attack roll depends on the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸 } of the target itself (not the creature it’s part of). Use the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸调整值 } table to determine any bonus or penalty for the target’s Scale. These modifiers are already listed in parentheses below for Normal scale creatures, along with any specific game effects：

  • HAND (-4): Target may be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.缴械]{卸武 }
  • HEAD OR VITALS (-4): Hitting the head or vital organs of living creatures adds +4 damage to the attacker’s total.
    The penalty is −5 if attempting to target the face of someone wearing an open-faced helmet (thus bypassing the helmet’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 }).
  • ITEM (?): Use the dimensions on the Scale table for items. Targeting something the size of a pistol, for example, is −4; a 3' long sword is −2.
  • LIMBS (-2): Hitting a limb has no additional special effect since it’s already accounted for by Wound and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } penalties (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }).
  • UNARMORED AREA (?): The attack targets the unprotected area of a target otherwise covered in @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 }. The penalty depends on the Scale of the area. The eyeslit of a helmet is Tiny (−6), for example, while the flesh beneath the missing scale of a Huge dragon might be Very Small (−4).

Cannons Table.name: 加农炮表
Cannons Table.description:
加农炮

加农炮 are used to destroy city walls or break up large troop formations. The leader of the weapon’s crew makes the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll.

Bombard： Assuming they have a rough idea of their target’s location, howitzers, mortars, and bombards may fire at targets they cannot see by lobbing projectiles over intervening terrain or obstacles. Bombarding suffers a −4 penalty in addition to all other modifiers, and doubles deviation when the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll is failed (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果攻击 }). Reduce the penalty to −2 with precise coordinates (such as from a spotter).

加农炮 can fire three different types of shells: solid shot, shrapnel, and canister. The crew can pick the type of ammunition to be loaded each time it reloads.

  • Solid Shot： Heavy balls of iron, lead, or stone designed to batter walls or plow through packed ranks of troops. To fire, the leader of the crew makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll as usual. If successful, roll a die. If even, it bounces to another victim behind and within 6” of the first and hits him as well. Continue in this way until the die roll is odd.
  • Shrapnel： Explosive shells filled with small metal balls that explode outward in a shower of debris. This is an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果攻击 } and uses the Medium Blast Template unless otherwise noted.
  • Canister： Grapeshot or canister is a shell that detonates inside the barrel of a cannon and fires out a spray of deadly balls or other debris like a giant shotgun. The attack is the size of a Medium Blast Template (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果攻击 }) and moves in a straight line up to 24” (it affects d6 targets if not using miniatures, or 2d6 if they’re tightly packed). Compare the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll to every target within using a base TN of 4, adjusted for each target’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽 }, special abilities like the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.闪避]{闪避专长 }, etc. A hit causes 2d6 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } and a raise causes 3d6.

Note： All types of shot are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.重武器 (HW)]{重武器 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.装填]{装填 } 8. Two crew members may reload at the same time.

Catapults

Catapults are simple devices that hurl large stones at enemy defenses or ranks of troops. They normally require a crew of eight to load the projectile, crank down the lever that propels it, then sight and aim it. Firing can be done by a single person, but loading the projectile takes at least four.
