Minimum Strength.name: 最低力量
Minimum Strength.description:
Certain items have a “Minimum Strength” required to use without penalty. Note that some items list a d4 since it is possible to have a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } lower than d4.

  • ARMOR/WORN GEAR: Each die type differ­ence between the character’s Strength and the item’s Minimum Strength inflicts a −1 penalty to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } (minimum of 1″), @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 }, and Agility-related skill rolls. This is cumulative for those weak but determined adventurers who wear or use multiple items too heavy for their build.
  • MELEE/THROWN WEAPONS: A thrown or melee weapon’s damage die is limited by the user’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } die. If a scrawny kid (Strength d4) picks up a long sword (Str+d8), he rolls d4+d4 damage instead of d4+d8. Also, if the user’s Strength is less than its Minimum Strength, he doesn’t benefit from any of the weapon’s positive abilities such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触及]{触及 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.格挡]{格挡 } bonuses. He still retains any penalties, however.
  • RANGED WEAPONS: The user suffers a −1 attack penalty for each die step difference between his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } and the weapon’s minimum.

Missiles Table.name: 导弹表
Missiles Table.description:
Missiles

Unless otherwise noted, missiles must “lock” onto their targets before they can be fired. This action is an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.电子学]{电子学 } roll versus the target’s maneuvering skill (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾船]{驾船 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾驶]{驾驶 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.航空]{航空 }, as appropriate). Success gives the attacker a “short” lock and allows him to fire up to half the missiles his particular craft can fire at once. A raise is a more solid lock and allows him to fire all of them.

The enemy attempts to evade each missile separately by making a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.追逐与载具]{机动 } roll at −4 (or −2 if the target has substantial cover to hide behind—such as asteroids, skyscrapers, canyon walls, or even large enemy ships. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } means the craft goes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.失控]{失控 }.

Anti-Missile Systems: Warships and futuristic space vessels often have “point defense” systems to shoot down incoming missiles. Operators must be on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.待机]{待机 } to shoot down missiles; automated systems attack automatically. The system grants a single @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll per missile at @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{近距 } and any other relevant modifiers (including @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.速度]{速度 }—missiles move at Mach 1, a −6 penalty, unless otherwise noted). Unless otherwise noted, missiles are objects with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 } of 8 (2) (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.破坏物体]{破坏物体 }).

More Skill Points.name: 更多技能点
More Skill Points.description:
更多技能点

Thanks to technology and improved education, characters in modern and futuristic settings have 15 Traits @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{技能点 } at character creation rather than 12. This helps them take @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾驶]{驾驶 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.电子学]{电子学 }, and other skills common in the modern world.

It’s up to the GM if this makes sense in her particular setting. A futuristic but “savage” world of planetary romance probably doesn’t need it, but it works well for most anything set in the developed world from about 1950 on, hard scifi, or “exploration” scifi like The Last Parsec.

Mounted Combat.name: 骑乘战斗
Mounted Combat.description:
Mounted Combat

Characters @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } from horseback (or other strange beasts) have certain advantages and disadvantages in combat, as described below.

Mounts aren’t dealt @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.行动卡 (先攻)]{行动卡 }—they act with their riders. Animals may attack any threat to their front during their rider’s action.

Horsemanship： Characters who wish to fight from horseback must use the lowest of their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.骑乘]{骑乘 } skills. This makes it important for cavalrymen to actually be able to ride well!

Falling： If a character is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } while mounted, or his mount is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 }, he must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.骑乘]{骑乘 } roll. If he fails, he falls. If the mount was running (GM’s call), the rider suffers 2d4 damage (2d6 with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{Critical Failure) }.

Missed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.攻击]{远程攻击 }： Mounts and riders are affected by the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.无辜旁人]{Innocent Bystander } rules. If a shot intended at a rider rolls a 1, it hits the horse instead.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } Mounts： When an animal is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }, it rears or bucks. A rider must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.骑乘]{骑乘 } roll to stay mounted, or falls as above.

Charging

A rider on a charging horse adds +4 to his damage roll with a successful @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } attack. To be considered charging, the rider must have moved at least 6″ or more in a relatively straight line toward his foe.

Setting Weapons： A weapon with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触及]{触及 } of 1 or greater can be “set” against a cavalry attack. To do so, the attacker must be on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.待机]{待机 } and win an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll to interrupt as usual. Whoever has the most @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触及]{触及 } adds +2 to his roll.

The winner attacks first. If successful, he adds the +4 charge bonus to his damage (whether he’s the rider or not).

Movement.description:
Movement

Characters can move a number of tabletop inches equal to their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{移速 } each turn.

Each inch of movement spent climbing, crawling, or swimming uses 2″ of Pace.

Running: A hero can “run” as a free action once per turn, increasing her Pace for the round by her Running die (a d6 by default) at the cost of a −2 penalty to all other actions that turn. Running dice never Ace. (The Running die is random to account for nuances of terrain not depicted on the tabletop and for the “risk to reward” decision players must make).

Out of combat situations, a character can move twice the sum of her full Pace + maximum running die for a number of minutes equal to half her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } die type. Thus a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.飞毛腿]{飞毛腿 } character with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } d6 can sprint at a Pace of 32 for three minutes.

Difficult Ground: Each inch a hero walks or runs over rough terrain such as thick forest, up or down a steep incline, slippery ice, etc., count as 2″ of her Pace. Crawling is unaffected by Difficult Ground.

Hazards： If the GM feels movement is hazardous for some reason—climbing under duress, swimming a fast-moving river, walking a tightrope—she can require an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll to move. Success means she continues on normally. With a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } the character takes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 } from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.肿痛与擦伤]{肿痛与擦伤 }, falls if climbing or in a precarious position (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.坠落]{坠落 }), or drowns if swimming (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.溺水]{溺水 }).

Other Movement Issues

  • JUMPING: Characters can jump 1″ (two yards) horizontally, or 0.5″ vertically as a free action. Double these numbers if the hero can run at least 2″ (four yards) prior to the jump. If the hero chooses, she may make an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll as an action to increase her horizontal distance by 1″ (2″ with a raise), or half that vertically. Jumping does not allow a character to exceed her total Pace for the turn.
  • PRONE: A character may fall prone as a free action during her turn. She may crawl while prone. Standing is a free action but reduces total Pace for the turn by 2.
Movement.name: 移动

Multi-Actions.name: 多重动作
Multi-Actions.description:
Multi-Actions

Characters can perform up to three @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 } on their turn. Each additional action beyond the first inflicts a −2 penalty to all actions. Taking two actions, for example, incurs a −2 penalty to both, and three actions is a −4 penalty.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } get their Wild Die on each action as usual.

All actions must be declared at the start of the turn and before any dice are rolled. Penalties remain even if a later action doesn’t happen (usually because it was dependent on an earlier success).

Movement and Multiple Actions： A chara­cter may perform multiple actions at different points in his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移动 }.

Free Actions： Multi-Action penalties do not apply to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{自由动作 }.

Multiple Languages.name: 多语言
Multiple Languages.description:
Multiple Languages

Some settings feature characters and cultures who typically speak many different languages. If this Setting Rule is in play, all characters have the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.语言学家]{语言学家专长 } for free, and ignore its usual Requirements.

A character who actually takes the Linguist Edge knows a number of languages equal to her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 } (instead of half her Smarts).

Natural Weapons.name: 天生武器
Natural Weapons.description:
Natural Weapons

Creatures with natural weapons such as fangs, claws, or horns may attack with any or all of them using their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } skill. Damage is stated for character races and beasts in their various descriptions.

Creatures with natural weapons are always considered armed. This means they aren’t an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.手无寸铁]{手无寸铁 } and foes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.双武器]{双武器 } gain no advantage against them. Here are a few additional notes for each type of attack：

  • BITE： The creature may bite a target it’s grappled (most attackers can only crush their prey, see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.擒抱]{擒抱 }).
  • CLAWS： +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } (climbing) rolls on any rough or soft surface (not sheer steel, glass, etc.).
  • HORNS： Add +4 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } at the end of one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } action in which it @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{奔跑 }, moves at least 5″(10 yards), and successfully hits with its horns.

Networking.name: 打点关系
Networking.description:
Networking

Your heroes often need to spend some time finding information or asking for favors. You can roleplay these encounters out, or you can allow them to use their skills in a “macro” sense—summing up hours of effort with a single roll.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } is the nice way of interacting with one’s contacts. The flip side of the coin is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 }. Either can get the job done but in slightly different ways, as shown below.

When to Use These 规则： Networking is a good way for social characters to spend their time while bookworm types are doing @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.调查]{调查 }.

The Basics： Characters use their Persuasion or Intimidation to gather favors or information. As always, the GM should apply any bonuses or penalties appropriate to the situation.

Persuasion (The Nice Way)

Characters use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } to socialize within their various social circles for information or favors. When used in this way, Persuasion isn’t a single exchange but several hours of networking, hobnobbing, carousing, drinks, gifts, bribes, or entertaining. This might represent time at the office, a series of meetings with important people, or (most commonly) an evening of dinner and drinks.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{成功 } grants most of what the character wants, though it may take a while, cost some money, or require a favor in return. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } either gets more of whatever he was looking for, or at a lower cost.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{失败 } means the hero’s efforts are in vain. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } means he’s cut off from that particular group for a while (up to the GM but typically about a week). 

Money Talks： You can catch more flies with honey than vinegar, the saying goes. A character with a little lucre to spread around adds +2 to her networking attempt by spending money on better bribes, gifts, or wining and dining her contacts.

The amount required is up to the GM, the setting, and the nature of the contact(s) she interacts with. As a rule of thumb, use the setting’s Starting Funds and modify as appropriate from there.

Intimidation (The Not-So-Nice-Way)

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 } can also be used to gather information, call in favors, or make demands, but it’s a little less savory.

Each attempt to “work the streets” takes several hours of threats and general unpleasantness, rousting the local populace for whatever the hero needs.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{成功 } grants the character most of what she wants, though her victims might decide to get some payback later on. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } means she gets more info, gets it faster, or her victims are too scared or otherwise preoccupied to plot revenge.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{失败 } means the goon doesn’t get anything useful. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } means she ends the evening with a fat lip, black eye, or broken nose (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.肿痛与擦伤]{肿痛与擦伤 }). She can work her contacts again the next day, but they’re more likely to be waiting for her this time!

Busting Heads： The bruiser can improve her odds by getting more violent or extreme than usual. This alienates her contacts for a week but adds +2 to the roll.

This raises the stakes as well. A simple failure means the evening ends with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.肿痛与擦伤]{肿痛与擦伤 }, and a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 }  bears more serious consequences. The GM might break the action down to an actual encounter (which might be an ambush!), she might run afoul of the law, come back with two levels of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 } from Bumps & Bruises, or her questions might trigger a deadly reaction from a more powerful enemy!

Example: Savage Mojo

Gabe is a private eye in Deadlands Noir. He needs to find out where the Red Hand, an evil voodoo cult in New Orleans, has taken the District Attorney.

Gabe’s Intimidation is better than his Persuasion, and he has the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.凶神恶煞]{凶神恶煞 } Edge that adds +2 to Intimidation rolls. Time is tight so he decides to bust some heads. That adds another +2 to his roll. With the +4 bonus he gets a success and a raise. Gabe finds where the DA is being held and how many guards are with her as well.

No Power Points.name: 无奇术点
No Power Points.description:
No Power Points

Instead of using @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 }, characters with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奥法背景 } simply choose the power they want to activate and make an arcane skill roll. The penalty to the roll is the power’s total cost in Power Points (base cost plus all @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术调整]{调整 }), divided by 2. Round up.

Casting @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.防护]{防护 } (1 point) with More Armor (+1) and the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.妨碍 or Hurry (+1)]{加快 } modifier (+1), for example, has a cost of 3 Power Points. Half rounded up is 2.

Success means the power activates as usual. A raise grants any additional bonuses stated in its description.

Failure means all current powers are canceled and the caster is Shaken. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } results in @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.启动]{反冲 }.

Maintaining Powers： Characters can main­tain those powers that allow it as long as desired, but each one maintained inflicts a −1 to all further arcane skill rolls.

Power Preparation: A caster may prepare powers by concentrating for an entire round (no move­ment or other actions and must not be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇或震慑 }). If successful, he ignores 2 points of penalties on all powers cast on his next turn. If he does not enact any powers on his next turn, the preparation is lost.

Nonlethal Damage.description:
Nonlethal Damage

A character who wants to beat someone up without killing them can choose to do nonlethal damage. This requires the attacker use only his fists or a blunt weapon of some sort. Edged weapons may be used if they have a flat side, but this subtracts −1 from the attacker’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } rolls.

Nonlethal damage causes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } as usual, but if a character is rendered @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 } he’s knocked out for 1d6 hours instead.

Nonlethal @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } are otherwise treated exactly as lethal @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }. This means it’s much easier to render an Extra unconscious than a Wild Card (See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色与龙套们 }). This is intentional, and should work well for most genres where heroes can take multiple punches before going down for the count, but most “mooks” go out with one or two good punches.
Nonlethal Damage.name: 非致命伤害

Off-Hand Attacks.name: 副手攻击
Off-Hand Attacks.description:
Off-Hand Attacks

Characters are assumed to be right-handed unless the player decides otherwise. Actions that require precise eye-hand coordination, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }, suffer a −2 penalty when done solely with the off-hand.

Off-hand weapons don’t add their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.格挡]{格挡 } bonus unless the hero is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.双巧手]{双巧手 }.

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description:
Parry

The weapon adds the bonus to the character’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 } score. If a character wields a weapon in each hand, penalties to Parry stack but bonuses do not (unless she has the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.双巧手]{双巧手专长 }).

Power Modifiers.name: 奇术调整
Power Modifiers.description:
Power Modifiers

Power Modifiers allow characters to customize their abilities, adding a special effect that better reflects her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术的 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }.

Power Modifiers are selected each time a power is activated and may be freely changed each time. An icy @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } might cause @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.穿甲 (AP)]{穿甲 } damage in one attack and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.持续伤害 (+2)]{持续伤害 } in the next.

A number of common modifiers are listed below, and some powers have additional options as well. The number in parentheses is the price in additional @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } it costs to add the effect.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{施法者 } must declare which modifiers they’re using before rolling their arcane skill.

Unless a modifier says otherwise, it may be applied to any power, but only once per casting.

Power Modifiers last for the Duration of the spell, or until the end of the target’s next turn in the case of Instant powers.

Powers.name: 奇术
Powers.description:
Powers

Most Savage Worlds settings feature “magic” in one form or another. Whether it’s hidden occult lore practiced only by dark cultists, voodoo rituals, the eldritch sorcery of powerful wizards, weird gadgets created by mad scientists, super powers, or brain-burning psionics, these rules handle it all in one simple system.

For ease of use, we call all of these effects “powers.” They work the same from game to game, but the particular use, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术调整]{调整值 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 } give the same core powers endless variations.

List of Powers

Listed below are a number of powers available in most Savage Settings. Each power has the following statistics：

Rank： The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{位阶 } a character must be to learn the power.

Power Points： The cost to activate the power in @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 }.

Range： The maximum distance between the caster and the power’s effect. Range is often expressed as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 }  or some multiple thereof. If so, read @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 } as inches on the tabletop (twice that in yards). A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 } of d10, for example, means the power can be cast up to 10″ (20 yards) away.

Unless the power says otherwise, Range has no effect after the power is activated. An ally who has been granted @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.隐形]{隐形 }, for example, may then move beyond the caster’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{聪慧 }  with no ill effect.

Duration： How long the power lasts in @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{轮 } (unless otherwise noted).

Powers expire at the end of the character’s turn X @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{轮 } later, where X is the Duration listed. Count the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{轮 } the power activated. If a psychic activates @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.提升/降低特性]{提升特性 } (Duration 5) on the second @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{轮 } of combat, for example, it remains in place until the end of her turn on the sixth @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{轮 }

Powers may be maintained for their base Duration for 1 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奇术点 } per individual.

Unless it says otherwise, the caster can ter­minate a power she’s activated as a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{自由动作 }. She must terminate the entire power—she can’t leave it on for some and off for others.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 } ： These are descriptive ideas and suggestions for how the power might look or manifest in different types of settings.

Naming Powers

Players are encouraged to note their powers’ Trappings and what the character might call them. A druid in a typical fantasy setting might write down his spells like this, for example：

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } (Splinters—shards of wood)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.提升/降低特性]{提升/降低特性 } (Blessing/Curse of Gaia —slight healthy or sickly green glow)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.纠缠]{纠缠 } (Entangle—grasping vines rise from the earth)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.防护]{防护 } (Bark skin—skin turns vaguely bark-like)

A mad scientist in the world of Deadlands: The Weird West might record the exact same powers like this：

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } (Acid gun)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.提升/降低特性]{提升/降低特性 } (Dr. Worthington’s Patented Pep Pills)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.纠缠]{纠缠 } (Dr. Worthington’s Fast-Drying Resin)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.防护]{防护 } (Electrostatic clothing)

Prone.name: 卧地
Prone.description:
Prone

Ranged attacks suffer a −4 penalty to hit prone characters from a range of 3″ or greater (this does not stack with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽 } and subtract four points of damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果攻击 }.

If a prone defender is caught in melee, his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 } is reduced by 2 and he must subtract 2 from his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } rolls.

Standing costs a character 2″ of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移动 }.

Push.name: 推撞
Push.description:
Push

Sometimes characters may want to push a foe in hopes of knocking him out of position, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.卧地]{卧地 }, or even into a deadly @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 }.

Pushing a foe is an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{对抗投骰 } of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 }. If the attacker is successful he pushes the foe back up to 1″ (two yards). With a raise, increase the distance to 2″ (four yards). Double either distance if the attacker’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸 } is larger than the foe’s.

A character who’s successfully Pushed must make an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } roll (at −2 if the attacker got a raise) or be knocked @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.卧地]{卧地 }.

Running： If the attacker ran at least 2″ (four yards) before the Push, he adds +2 to his total.

Size Matters： Creatures may not generally Push a foe more than two @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型 } larger then themselves unless they have exceptional @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } for their Size (GM’s call).

Skill: The attacker or defender may roll @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } instead of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } if they choose.

Shields: Attackers and defenders add their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.盾牌]{shield’s Parry bonus } to their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } (or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 }) rolls when pushing.

Races.name: 种族
Races.description:
RACE行家

并非每一位角色都得是人类。以下是一些在大部分科幻小说以及奇幻设定中的常见范例种族，可以直接或略作修改后用在大家的特定世设里，在这些范例之后也有供大家创造自设种族的指南。

注意这些种族里涉及了许多这里尚未阐明的规则。这里可以先行跳过，然后在把握了游戏剩下的部分后再回头浏览。

Races

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.仿生人]{仿生人 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.鲛人]{鲛人 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.翼民]{翼民 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.矮人]{矮人 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.精灵]{精灵 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.半精灵]{半精灵 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.半身人]{半身人 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.人类]{人类 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.猫族]{猫族 }

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.蜥蜴人]{蜥蜴人 }

打破模式

展示在这里的种族范型是其在奇幻或科幻小说中的标志形象，但玩家和GM可以随意将其改变得和自己的特定世设相互契合。

也许在你世界中的猫族长有翅膀，或者鲛人们都是有八条手臂的原始食人族，并在末日后的水世界里捕猎着比自己更要发达的种族。

你也能创造同属于一族的不同版本。也许某一地区的猫族进化到能抵御@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{严寒 }(他们更像是雪豹)，而其他地方的同类则有猎豹一般的弹跳力(因此把@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.飞毛腿]{飞毛腿 }专长作为其种族能力)。唯二限制你的只有想象力，以及创造非凡新事物的欲望！

Radiation.name: 辐射
Radiation.description:
Radiation

Characters in a radioactive environment must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{投骰 } every hour spent in low radiation, and every minute in high radiation. Each failure results in a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 } level.

Radiation Poisoning： An Incapacitated victim con­tracts radiation sickness, a Chronic Disease, as explained under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 }.

Range.name: 射程
Range.description:
Range

This lists the weapon’s Short, Medium, and Long Range. Extreme Range is up to 4×its Long Range. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.攻击]{远程攻击 } for @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } (throwing) modifiers and more details.

Ranges are listed in inches so you can use a ruler to move, shoot, and fight on the tabletop with miniatures. If you’re not using miniatures, each inch is equal to two yards.

Weapon ranges are “effective” ranges for the table-top. If you need to know the real world range of a weapon (for battles that don’t take place on the table-top, for instance), multiply each range bracket by 2.5.

Range (+1 or +2).name: 增距 (+1 或 +2)
Range (+1 or +2).description:
Range (+1/+2)

Double the power’s listed Range for 1 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奇术点 }, or triple it for +2. This modifier may not be used on powers with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.接触攻击]{接触 } or the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.主持游戏]{锥形盖板 }.

Ranged Weapons In Melee.name: 近战中的远程武器
Ranged Weapons In Melee.description:
Ranged Weapons In Melee

Heroes may fire ranged weapons when engaged in melee with a few caveats：

  • The attacker may only use a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇术]{奇术 } or a one-handed ranged weapon (such as a firearm no larger than a pistol) when in melee. He may not fire rifles or other “long arms.” The TN is the defender’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 } instead of Short Range as he struggles, wrestles back and forth, etc.
  • If attacking a non-adjacent target with a ranged attack while in melee, the attacker instantly becomes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 }.

Rate of Fire.name: 射速
Rate of Fire.description:
Rate of Fire

This is the number of shots that may be fired by this weapon in a single action. See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.攻击]{远程武器 } for further details.

Reach.name: 触及
Reach.description:
Reach

Weapons with “Reach” allow their user to make @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } attacks at the listed range. A Reach of 1, for example, allows a character to strike a target 1″ distant. Weapons without a Reach value can only strike targets at arm’s length (adjacent).

Reach can be very important when fighting from horseback and against mounted foes (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.骑乘战斗]{骑乘战斗 }).

Readying Weapons.description:
预备武器

Characters may “ready” up to two items per turn as a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{自由动作 }. Readying means drawing, holstering, or otherwise moving an item into or out of a familiar and easy-to-reach location.

Each additional item readied is an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }, as is readying an item from a difficult location such as an ankle holster, off the floor after being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.缴械]{卸武 }, or other exten­uating circumstances.
Readying Weapons.name: 预备武器

Recoil.name: 后坐力
Recoil.description:
Recoil

Unless it says otherwise in its description, firing at a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 } greater than 1 in one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 } causes Recoil, a −2 penalty to the attacker’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } rolls. A submachine gun with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 } of 3, for example, causes Recoil unless its user fires only a single shot.

Recoil isn’t cumulative between @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }. If a character fires three shots (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射速]{射速 } 3) on one action and triggers the Recoil penalty, he ignores it on a second action if he only fires a single shot.

Reloading.description:
Reloading

Nocking an arrow or loading a stone in a sling are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{自由动作 } that may be performed once per @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }. Reloading a crossbow bolt, clip, magazine, speed loader, or single bullet so that it’s ready to fire (chambered, cocked, etc.) is an action.

Some weapons are slower to reload, like heavy crossbows or black powder weapons. They require a number of actions to reload, listed as “Reload X” in their description.

Example： Gabe fires a heavy crossbow (Reload 2) as part of a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.多重动作]{多重动作 }, using his other two actions that turn to reload. Since this is three actions, his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll is made at −4. On the following round, he can fire again at no penalty.

Running & Reloading： Characters who @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{奔跑 } and load must make an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 } roll (at the usual −2 penalty for running). Failure means no progress toward reloading was made that action.

Savage Worlds provides a simple framework for your tales of adventure and glory. In this chapter we show you how to make basic @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{技能与属性检定 }—and make your @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{战斗 } Fast, Furious, and Fun!

Setting Rules.description:
Setting 规则

Savage Worlds range from dark and gritty detective tales to cinematic epics to political thrillers. These rules provide a great framework for anything you want to do, but adding the right Setting 规则 really brings the world and the action to life!

When to Use These 规则： Setting 规则 accommodate different play styles and help emulate genres or tropes of established settings—like those of a book or movie that’s inspired you. This lets you easily tweak the rules to make a gritty crime drama more bloody, or an adventurous space romp more fun—all without changing the core of the game.

The Basics： Each Setting Rule is different. Some apply during @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色创建概要]{角色创建 } while others tweak @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.战斗]{战斗 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{技能 }, or even @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 } use in some way.

Setting Rule Checklist

Use the following list to choose the Setting 规则 for your game, coloring in the dots so everyone in the group knows which rules are in effect.

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.英雄处诞]{英雄处诞 }： Player characters ignore @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{位阶 } requirements for @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } during @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色创建概要]{角色创建 }.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.信念点]{信念点 }： Heroes gain Conviction Tokens that can be used to add a d6 to all @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } rolls for one round. Conviction is awarded for triumph (overcoming a great obstacle important to that character), and tragedy (a personal setback, death of a friend or ally, etc). Conviction effects may be extended by spending a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 }.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.创新战斗]{创新战斗 }： A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 } on a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.考验]{考验 } allows the character to roll on a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.创新战斗]{特殊表 } that grants additional effects.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.狗屎运]{狗屎运 }： Characters may spend a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 } after a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 }, allowing another chance for success in unusual and unexpected ways.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动态反冲]{动态反冲 }： A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{大失败 } on an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{奥法 } skill roll forces the player to roll on a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动态反冲]{特殊表 } with various chaotic results.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.狂热者]{狂热者 }： Enemy thugs take the damage for their masters.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.快速恢复]{快速恢复 }： Characters make natural @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.恢复]{医疗 } rolls once per day instead of every five days, and recover a level of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 } from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.肿痛与擦伤]{肿痛与擦伤 } every four hours instead of every day.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.英雄不灭]{英雄不灭 }： Heroes and named villains rarely actually die but return in some way after being defeated.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.更多技能点]{更多技能点 }： Player characters in advanced or specialized settings start with 15 skill points.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.无奇术点]{无奇术点 }： Those with arcane backgrounds don’t track @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奥法背景]{获得奇术点 } but instead subtract half the listed Power Point cost (round up) from their skill roll to activate the ability. Powers may be maintained as desired at a −1 penalty to all further arcane skill rolls.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.技能专精]{技能专精 }： Characters choose a specialization for each skill and subtract 2 when using other variations.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.无甲勇士]{无甲勇士 }： @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } without armor add +2 to their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.化解投骰]{化解 } rolls.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.损伤阈值]{损伤阈值 }： @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 } never suffer more than four @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } from a single hit.

Shields.name: 盾牌
Shields.description:
Shields

Shields add to a character’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{格挡 } as shown in the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.盾牌表]{盾牌表 }. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{掩蔽 } subtracts from ranged attacks from the front and shielded side (attacks from the rear or unprotected side ignore cover).

Medieval shields are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.破坏物体]{硬度 } 10 and provide +2 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 } should someone attempt to shoot through them (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.掩蔽与障碍]{障碍 }). Modern shields are Hardness 12 and also provide +2 Armor. Polymer shields are Hardness 10 and provide Armor +4.

While worn, shields can be used to bash for Str+d4 damage.

Shotguns.name: 霰弹枪
Shotguns.description:
Shotguns

Shotguns fire a spread of metal “shot,” and so do more @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } at close @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } where more of the shot hits the target. Because of this, shotguns add +2 to the user’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } rolls and cause 3d6 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } at Short @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }, 2d6 at Medium, and 1d6 at Long. Shotguns may not be fired at Extreme @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }.

Double Barrels： Some shotguns have two barrels welded side-by-side. If an attacker wants to fire both barrels at the same target, roll @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } once and add +4.

Slugs: Shotguns can also fire slugs. The attacker doesn’t get the +2 shotgun bonus to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } roll, but the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害]{伤害 } is 2d10 regardless of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 } (and they may be fired at Extreme @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.射程]{射程 }). @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.无辜旁人]{无辜旁人 } are hit only on a 1 (instead of 1 or 2).

Size and Scale.name: 体型与尺寸
Size and Scale.description:
Size & Scale

Characters and creatures have a Size ranging from −4 for very small beings up to Size 20 and higher for massive behemoths. Specific creature Sizes are listed in their statistics, and explained on the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型表]{体型表 }.

The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型表]{体型表 } lists seven different “Scales,” from Tiny to Gargantuan, and the Scale Modifier that goes with each.

When creatures of different Scales attack each other, the smaller creature adds the difference between its Scale and its target to its attacks. A Tiny fairy (−6 Scale modifier), for example, adds +10 to hurl a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } at a Huge dragon (+4).

The larger creature subtracts the difference from its attacks. A Very Small eagle (−4) subtracts 2 from its Fighting totals when attacking a Tiny fairy (−6).

Scale Modifiers
Modifier Scale & Examples
-6 Tiny： Armor join, baseball, mouse
-4 Very Small： Human hand or head, basketball, house cat
-2 Small： Human limb, bobcat
— Normal： Human, motorc­ycle, bull, horse
+2 Large： Hippo, most vehicles
+4 Huge： Dragon, whale
+6 Gargantuan： Building, kaiju, ship

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 } & Target Size

Use the Scale of the target when making @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 } against creatures, not their Scale. If a hero wants to blast the eye of a Huge robot destroying the city, for example, use the Scale of the eye, not the robot. If the eye is about the size of a car, the hero adds +2 to his roll because a car is Large, a +2 bonus.

Hitting the vital areas have extra effects listed under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }.

Skill Specialization.name: 技能专精
Skill Specialization.description:
Skill Specialization

Savage Worlds skills are intended to be broad, allowing characters to focus primarily on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.专长]{专长 } for customization rather than multiple iterations of something like @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 } for edged weapons, Fighting for blunt weapons, etc.

If it’s important to have more detail for some reason, the GM can decide some skills require specialization. A character chooses one particular use of that skill to roll normally, and subtracts 2 from the total when using it in any other way.

Gaining an additional specialization counts as raising a skill below its linked @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{属性 }. So a character can gain two new specializations with an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.升级]{升级 }, or mix and match to gain a specialization and increase a skill below its linked Attribute.

Below are skills appropriate for this extra detail and some example specializations：

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾船]: Powered, Sail, Steam.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.驾驶]: Hover, Tracked, Wheeled.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]: Axe, Blunt Weapon, Exotic (such as nunchaku; each is separate), Long Blade, Pole Arm, Short Blade.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.航空]{航空 }: Fixed Wing, Rotary, Space.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.骑乘]{骑乘 }: Camel, Horse, Dragon.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.科学]{科学 }: Biology, Chemistry, Engineering.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }: Bows, Pistol, Rifle, Shotgun.
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.生存]{生存 }: Arctic, Desert, Temperate.

Sleep.name: 睡眠
Sleep.description:
Sleep

Most people need a minimum of six hours’ sleep out of every 24. A character who goes without must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{投骰 } at a cumulative −2 every 24 hours thereafter (to a maximum penalty of −4) or suffer @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疲乏]{疲乏 }. A large amount of coffee, soda, or other stimulant adds +2 to the roll.

Snapfire.name: 猝射
Snapfire.description:
Snapfire

Certain weapons, such as heavy sniper rifles, are very inaccurate if fired from the hip rather than using their sights, scopes, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.两脚架/三脚架]{两脚架 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.两脚架/三脚架]{三叉戟 }. If a character moves in the round he fires a Snapfire weapon, he suffers a −2 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 } penalty.

Soak Rolls.name: 化解投骰
Soak Rolls.description:
Soak Rolls

After rolling damage but before applying wounds, a character may spend a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.助力点]{助力点 } to make a “Soak” roll. This is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } check, with each success and raise reducing the number of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } suffered from that attack by one.

If the character Soaks all of the Wounds from an attack, he removes his Shaken condition too (even from a previous source). Don’t count the Wound modifiers he’s about to suffer when making this roll—that hasn’t happened yet.

Characters can’t Soak more than once per attack, but may spend Bennies as usual to reroll the Vigor check if they aren’t satisfied with the results.

Shaken: A character can also spend a Benny to immediately eliminate a Shaken condition. This can be done at any time.

Social Conflict.name: 社交冲突
Social Conflict.description:
Social Conflict

Not every conflict is won by the blade. Successful oratory can topple nations.

When to Use These 规则： Most social exchanges are a simple skill roll resisted by the appropriate @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{特性 }, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } vs. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 }. For longer interactions, such as the back and forth of a long argument, negotiation, or a legal proceeding, the following system adds some drama and structure to each side’s discussion. (The GM might use a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.剧情任务]{剧情任务 } instead if the argument must be won in a hurry!)

The Basics： Characters make arguments back and forth over three rounds, roll their appropriate skills, then consult the Conflict Results table (below) to see how well they’ve influenced their audience.

Conflict Rounds

The conflict is broken down into three rounds of conversation, each focusing on a particular point (or a few highly connected points).

During each round, the player roleplays her character’s argument and makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } roll opposed by the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 } of whoever she’s trying to convince. If a rival argues against her, the roll is opposed by his Persuasion instead.

Each success and raise by the petitioner grants her an “Influence Token” (rivals don’t gain tokens, they just oppose the petitioner and keep her from gaining them).

Modifiers： @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } rolls should be modi­fied by the situation as the GM sees fit. A hero trying to convince a scientist of a fact within his field rolls the lowest of his Persuasion or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.科学]{科学 }. A particularly brilliant argument or impassioned roleplaying might add +1 to +4. An insult or faux pas inflicts a similar penalty.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.负赘]{负赘 } should also be considered. Convincing a jury that an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.异客]{异客 } (主要) is innocent of a crime, for example, carries a −2 penalty.

Results

At the end of the third round, the speaker looks up her total Influence Tokens on the Social Conflict Results table below.

Trials： Run trials and similar conflicts from the accuser’s point of view since they must usually prove the accused’s guilt. If the player characters are the defenders, they oppose the prosecution and must keep them from gaining Influence Tokens with the judge (baron, king, warlord, etc.).

Accusers in a trial must get at least three tokens to convict. Lesser or greater results indicate the degree of punishment based on the setting’s customs and laws.

Social Conflict Results
Tokens Results
0 Pleas are denied and negotiations fail. Discussions may reopen if new information is presented or favors are performed. In a trial, the defendant is acquitted.
1-3 The target isn’t truly convinced, but provides the minimum amount of support possible. In a trial, the defendant receives the minimum penalty.
4-5 The arbiter is reasonably convinced or willing to help. He grants the aid requested, more or less, but only under certain conditions or in exchange for payment, tasks, favors, etc. The prosecution is successful with typical sentencing in a trial.
6+ The target is eager to help or agree. He gives more than expected in a negotiation or provides more support than requested. A defendant is convicted with the maximum penalty.

Example: To Arms!

Red must convince a baron to send troops to the defense of a neighboring fiefdom. The barony has warred with his neighbor for generations so the GM decides that’s a −4 penalty to Red’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.交涉]{交涉 } rolls.

Worse, she’s opposed by his slimy wizard, who argues against the idea every round (he opposes her Persuasion rolls).

Red gets lucky the first round and gets a success and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 }. That’s two Influence Tokens. She fails on the second, but gets one more in the third.

That’s three tokens in total. The baron agrees but requires payment in land from his neighbor in return for sending part of his army to his rival’s defense.

Special Ability (Aquatic).name: 特殊能力 (水栖)
Special Ability (Aquatic).description:
Aquatic

The creature is native to the water. It is a natural swimmer and cannot drown. Its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } in water is specified after the Aquatic ability.

Special Ability (Armor).name: 特殊能力 (护甲)
Special Ability (Armor).description:
Armor

A creature’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.护甲]{护甲 } is written in parentheses next to its total @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }, and already added in. Thick, leathery hide generally offers 2 points of Armor. Creatures like a stegosaurus generally have 4 or more points of protection. Supernatural creatures may have much higher Armor values. A living statue, for example, might have 8 points of Armor or more.

Special Ability (Breath Weapons).name: 特殊能力 (吐息武器)
Special Ability (Breath Weapons).description:
Breath Weapons

Dragons and other “fire breathers” use a Cone Template for their attacks (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果攻击 }). Breath attacks may be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.回避]{规避 }.

Unless the creature’s description says otherwise, breath attacks take the creature’s entire turn — they can’t perform @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.多重动作]{多重动作 } in the same round they make a breath attack.

Special Ability (Burrow).name: 特殊能力 (遁地)
Special Ability (Burrow).description:
Burrow

From massive worms to sand-dwelling humanoids, many creatures are able to burrow beneath the earth and move within it.

Burrowers can tunnel underground and reappear elsewhere for devastating surprise attacks against their foes. The distance a creature can burrow on its turn is written immediately after its Burrow ability.

A burrowing creature may tunnel on its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }, and may erupt from the ground at any point within its burrowing @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } in the same turn. It cannot be attacked while beneath the earth unless the attacker has some special means of detecting it and penetrating the intervening dirt.

Burrowing creatures erupt from beneath their opponents and may take them by surprise. If the target was unaware of the burrower’s presence, the creature makes an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.潜行]{潜行 } roll versus the victim’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.察觉]{察觉 }. If the burrower wins, the target is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } to it only. With a raise, the burrower gets @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.奇袭]{奇袭 }. Targets on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.待机]{待机 } may attempt to interrupt the attack before it occurs.

Burrowers can’t usually surprise a foe once their presence is known, but can still burrow for protection and mobility.

Special Ability (Construct).name: 特殊能力 (构装体)
Special Ability (Construct).description:
Construct

Robots, golems, and other animated objects are collectively called “constructs.” Some are sentient beings while others are mere automatons following the will of their masters.

Whatever their origin or material, constructs have several inherent advantages over creatures of flesh and blood.

Constructs add +2 when attempting to recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }, ignore 1 point of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }, don’t @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{失血 }, and Wounds are removed with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.修理]{修理 } instead of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{医疗 } with no @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{“Golden Hour.” }

Special Ability (Elemental).name: 特殊能力 (元素)
Special Ability (Elemental).description:
Elemental

Air, earth, fire, and water form the basis of the elemental realms, wherein dwell strange, unfathomable creatures.

Elementals have bodies of pure earth, water, air, or fire and thus ignore additional damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }, ignore 1 point of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }, can only be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.医疗]{治疗 } via magic or natural healing.

Special Ability (Environmental Resistanc.name: 特殊能力 (环境抗力)
Special Ability (Environmental Resistanc.description:
Environmental Resistance

The creature is resistant (but not immune) to a particular type of energy or substance, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{寒冷 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.高温]{高温 }, iron, etc.

Damage from the source is reduced by 4, and the being adds +4 to resist matching @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 } or powers with a similar @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }.

Special Ability (Environmental Weakness).name: 特殊能力 (环境弱点)
Special Ability (Environmental Weakness).description:
Environmental Weakness

The creature is susceptible to a particular type of energy or substance, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{寒冷 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.高温]{高温 }, iron, etc.

Damage from the source is increased by 4, and the being subtracts 4 when resisting matching @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 } or powers with a similar @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }.

Special Ability (Ethereal).name: 特殊能力 (灵态)
Special Ability (Ethereal).description:
Ethereal

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.鬼魂]{鬼魂 }, shadows, will-o’-the-wisps, and similar intangible creatures have no form in the physical world (or can turn it on and off at will). They can pass through physical objects, cannot be harmed by non-magical attacks, and cannot even be seen unless they desire to be. Ethereal creatures are affected by magical items, weapons, and supernatural powers.

Unless its description says otherwise, ethereal creatures can throw objects, wield weapons, or even push terrified heroes down long, dark stairs.

Special Ability (Fear).name: 特殊能力 (恐惧)
Special Ability (Fear).description:
Fear

Particularly frightening monsters cause @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.恐惧]{恐惧 } checks to all who see them. Some truly terrifying monsters may inflict penalties on Fear checks as well. A creature with Fear −2, for instance, causes those who see it to make their Fear checks at −2. See the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.恐惧]{恐惧 } rules for effects.

Special Ability (Fearless).name: 特殊能力 (无畏)
Special Ability (Fearless).description:
Fearless

Mindless creatures, some undead, robots, and the like don’t suffer from the weaknesses of the mortal mind. Fearless creatures are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.恐惧]{恐惧 } effects and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.威吓]{威吓 }. They may still be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.嘲弄]{嘲弄 }, however (usually because it draws their attention rather than causing emotional distress).

Special Ability (Flight).description:
Flight

The creature can fly at the listed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }. It uses its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } to maneuver in chases or other situations.
Special Ability (Flight).name: 特殊能力 (飞行)

Special Ability (Gargantuan).description:
Gargantuan

Gargantuan creatures are those that are at least @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型 } 12 or higher. Classic movie monsters like Godzilla fall into this category.

Gargantuans have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.载具注释]{重护甲 }, can take three additional @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }, and their attacks count as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.重武器 (HW)]{重武器 }.

Stomp： A Gargantuan creature may stomp by using an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.范围效果攻击]{范围效果盖板 } (the size of the template is determined by the GM based on the monster’s “footprint”). The attack ignores @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{尺寸 } modifiers and is an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.运动]{运动 } vs @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{灵巧 } roll (defenders roll individually). Those who can’t get out of the way are stomped for damage equal to the thing’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } damage.
Special Ability (Gargantuan).name: 特殊能力 (巨型)

Special Ability (Hardy).description:
Hardy

Very tough or determined creatures do not fall from lesser injuries, no matter how many they suffer. A decisive blow is needed to put one of these tenacious creatures down.

If the beast is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }, another Shaken result doesn’t cause a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }.
Special Ability (Hardy).name: 特殊能力 (顽强)

Special Ability (Immunity).name: 特殊能力 (免疫)
Special Ability (Immunity).description:
Immunity

Creatures born in fire aren’t affected by @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.高温]{高温 }, and a horror made of pure lightning won’t suffer from a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.矢箭]{矢箭 } attack with an electrical @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特效]{特效 }. Immunities are to specific types of attacks, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.火焰]{火焰 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.寒冷]{寒冷 }, electricity, and so on. Such creatures don’t have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特殊能力 (无敌)]{无敌 }, they just ignore @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{伤害 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 } results from the specific attack types named.

Special Ability (Infection).name: 特殊能力 (感染)
Special Ability (Infection).description:
Infection

A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.吸血鬼]{吸血鬼 }’s bite, a horrid @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.巨蜘蛛]{蜘蛛 }-like creature that injects eggs into its victim’s skin, or even the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 }-born scratching of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.集群]{老鼠 } are all examples of Infection.

A character @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } by a creature with Infection must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll. Modifiers to the roll are listed in the creature’s description, as are the effects of failure.

Special Ability (Infravision).name: 特殊能力 (红外感应)
Special Ability (Infravision).description:
Infravision

Nocturnal beasts often see in the infrared spectrum—meaning they can “see” by detecting heat. Creatures with Infravision halve penalties for bad lighting when attacking targets that radiate warmth (including invisible foes).

Clever characters may figure out ways to mask their heat from such creatures. Smearing cold mud over one’s body or wearing special heat-filtering suits generally obscures the target from those with Infravision.

Humanoids with Infravision usually have normal sight as well.

Special Ability (Invulnerability).name: 特殊能力 (无敌)
Special Ability (Invulnerability).description:
Invulnerability

Some Savage Tales feature invulnerable horrors that can only be defeated by discovering their weakness.

Invulnerable creatures ignore damage as listed in their description. Unless otherwise specified, they can be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }或@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 } but not @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } by other forms of damage. An ancient dark god given life by misguided cultists, for example, might only be vulnerable to shards of stained glass gathered from a church.

Special Ability (Low Light Vision).name: 特殊能力 (微光视觉)
Special Ability (Low Light Vision).description:
Low Light Vision

Low Light Vision ignores penalties for Dim and Dark @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.照明]{照明 } (but not Pitch Darkness).

Special Ability (Paralysis).name: 特殊能力 (麻痹)
Special Ability (Paralysis).description:
Paralysis

Paralyzing poisons are covered under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }. Other creatures might paralyze their victims with magic, electricity, or other sources. Victims who suffer damage or a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } result from such a creature must make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } roll or be @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.震慑]{震慑 }. They’re also paralyzed and incapable of any action—even speech—for 2d6 rounds (or longer if otherwise specified).

Special Ability (Poison).description:
Poison

Snakes, spiders, and other creatures inject @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{有毒 } venom via bite or scratch. To do so, the thing must cause at least a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 } result to the victim, who then makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll modified by the strength of the poison (listed in parentheses after the creature’s Poison ability). Effects of failure are described in more detail in the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.危难]{危难 } section.
Special Ability (Poison).name: 特殊能力 (毒素)

Special Ability (Regeneration).description:
Regeneration

Legend has it that @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.巨魔]{巨魔 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.吸血鬼]{吸血鬼 }, and certain other types of legendary creatures can Regenerate damage caused to them.

Regeneration comes in two types: Fast and Slow.

  • FAST: Wounded creatures make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{活力 } roll every round—even after they’ve been @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 }. A success heals one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } (or removes Incapacitated status), and a raise heals an additional Wound. Wounds caused by some types of damage, listed in the creature’s description, do not regenerate but may still @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.恢复]{治疗 } naturally. Trolls cannot regenerate Wounds caused by flame, for example.
  • SLOW: The creature makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.恢复]{自然恢复投骰 } once per day.
Special Ability (Regeneration).name: 特殊能力 (再生)

Special Ability (Resilient or Very Resil.name: 特殊能力 (强韧/非常强韧)
Special Ability (Resilient or Very Resil.description:
Resilient/Very Resilient

Elite @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{龙套 } are tougher than usual. This might include specially bred @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.兽人]{兽人 } in a fantasy setting, particularly tough thugs or agents in the modern world, or even mutant animals created in the lab of some mad scientist.

Resilient Extras can take one @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } before they’re @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{无力化 }, Very Resilient Extras can take two. Wild Cards can’t be Resilient or Very Resilient. The abilities exist to bring select Extras a little closer to the heroes and villains who lead them.

Special Ability (Size).name: 特殊能力 (体型)
Special Ability (Size).description:
Size

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型 } grants a bonus to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 } (or penalty for small creatures) and is a guide to the typical @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } of creatures in that general range.

Size is generally based on mass, but exceptions exist for extremely large but weak creatures, small but strong beings, etc.

Scale Modifiers are explained under @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.体型与尺寸]{体型&尺寸 }.

Additional Wounds： Large creatures can take an additional @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }, Huge can take two, and Gargantuan three. The maximum @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalty is always three. This stacks with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特殊能力 (强韧/非常强韧)]{特殊能力 (强韧/非常强韧) }.

Such creatures typically have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触及]{触及 } equal to the additional Wounds granted by Size.

Special Ability (Tentacles).name: 特殊能力 (触手)
Special Ability (Tentacles).description:
Tentacles

The creature has a number of “tentacle actions” specified in its description (usually 2 or 4). Tentacle actions collectively count as one of a creature’s three potential actions for the turn. The actions must stem from the tentacle in some way—usually a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.格斗]{格斗 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.射击]{射击 }或是@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.擒抱]{擒抱 } attack, but this is the GM’s call.

If the creature is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.不羁角色与龙套们]{不羁角色 }, it rolls its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{不羁骰 }with each tentacle action as usual.

If the being performs other actions on its turn, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.嘲弄]{嘲弄 } or casting a spell, these and the tentacle actions are affected by the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.多重动作]{多重动作 } penalty as usual.

Grappling rolls made with tentacles get a +2 bonus, and “crushing” causes the creature’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{力量 } in damage unless otherwise listed.

Severing a tentacle is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }. If damage exceeds the creature’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 }, the limb is severed and the monster is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }. If it was already Shaken, it takes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 }.

Special Ability (Undead).description:
Undead

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.行尸]{丧尸 }、@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.骷髅]{骷髅 }, and similar physical horrors are particularly difficult to destroy. Below are the benefits of being such an abomination.

  • Add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.角色]{坚韧 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性]{心魂 } rolls to recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{动摇 }, ignore addi­tional damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.定点攻击]{定点攻击 }, ignore 1 point of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{损伤 } penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.疾病]{疾病 } and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.毒素]{毒素 }, don’t @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.伤害效果]{失血 }, and can only be healed with magical @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.医疗]{医疗 }.
Special Ability (Undead).name: 特殊能力 (不死族)

Special Ability (Weakness).name: 特殊能力 (弱点)
Special Ability (Weakness).description:
Weakness

Some creatures suffer additional damage or can only be hurt by their Weakness. A creature made of ice, for example, might take double damage from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.火焰]{火焰 }. See the creature’s description for particular effects.

Speed.name: 速度
Speed.description:
Speed

Characters occasionally need to attack fast-moving targets. If the relative speed between attacker and defender is 60 Miles per Hour (MPH) or more, apply the Relative Speed Penalty：

Relative Speed Penalty
Penalty Target's Relative Speed Is...
-1 60 MPH+
-2 120 MPH+
-4 240 MPH+
-6 Mach 1+
-8 Mach 2+
-10 Near Light Speed+
  • Multiply MPH by 1.5 to get @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 }
  • Divide @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移速 } by 1.5 to get MPH

Stunned.name: 震慑
Stunned.description:
Stunned

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-equipment.电击枪]{电击枪 }, creature abilities, the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.震慑]{震慑 } power, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.触电]{触电 } hazards, or other shocks to the brain or nervous system make a character essentially helpless until they manage to shake it off.

Stunned Characters

  • Are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{分神 } (this is removed at the end of the victim's next turn as usual)
  • Are @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } (this remains until they recover from being Stunned)
  • Fall @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.卧地]{卧地 } (or to their knees, GM’s call)
  • Can’t @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.移动]{移动 } or take any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{动作 }
  • Don’t count toward the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.围攻]{围攻 } bonus

Recovery： At the start of a Stunned character’s turn, he makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{活力 } roll as a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.动作]{自由动作 }. Success means he’s no longer Stunned but remains @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } until the end of his next turn. With a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.特性投骰]{优良 }, his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.分神与脆弱]{脆弱 } state goes away at the end of this turn.

Submachine Guns Table.description:
Submachine Guns

Typical magazine sizes are listed with each weapon. Additional magazines are available at 10% of the weapon’s cost and weigh about 1 lb each, fully loaded.

Notes: Thompson submachine guns may also use a 50-round drum. This increases the weight by 2 lbs and each loaded drum costs $50.
